page.title: 01FORESTS NORTH OF BROXA
page.content: Predominantly a forested block for commercial softwood production. The southern area has some farmed land in the small valleys and ridge tops, primarily grain and grassland for sheep. Characteristic scenery of flat topped hills disected by steep sided river walleys. In south often only the upper slopes are forested and the lower slopes and valley and the flat tops are farmed. The river Derwent bisects the area. The scenery is spectacular and much visited by tourists, mainly on foot because public roads hardly touch on this area. There are many footpaths and rights of way for the walker though. There are very few residents and those few there are seem to be involved in farming.
